Description: Ivory scribal palette. Two ink wells at the top preserve the remains of red and black pigment. Two rush pens are inserted into the pen slot, the shorter one bearing black ink stains. The palette is not inscribed, but hieratic jottings in black ink cover much of the lower half of the upper surface. The reverse side bears further hieratic inked text, with reference to measurements, and records of sacks of grain being issued.
Curator's comments: Published: PM I Part 2: p.843. Glanville, S.R.K., JEA Vol.18, 1932, p. 56, pl. IV, 2,3. For a range of scribal palettes, see Parkinson, Cracking Codes (London, 1999), 143-6
Acquisition notes: Lot 1056 `A painter's palette in ivory, contaiing two brushes, and covered with Hieratic characters' from Thebes.
